page.title: 05St.Helena's Church,Leverton
page.content: Our church is the only building in the village more than 200 years old.It is built of {oolitic limestone}from the quarry at{Ancaster}near Grantham.The church was built by merchants who made their fortunes selling wool.The church took over 100 years to build because it coincided with the arrival of{the {Black Death} in the 14th century.The church has many crosses because St.Helena was the mother of Constantine the Great who was thought to have found the cross that Jesus was crucified on.During the Civil War the Puritan army used the church as a stable and,while they were there,they desecrated it by pulling out the mediaeval stained glass and broke or damaged the statues.There are a few small pieces remaining in various places but the rest has never been replaced.
